name: mongodb_notes
description: - Collection: database can contain various 'collections'. For example   a blog database could have a collection for "Users", "Blog Posts",   and "Comments". Each collection is in charge of storing its own   respective data. - Documents: A document represents a record in the database. For example   a single document in the 'Users' collection would contain information about   an individual user. The data for the user would be formatted in a structure   similar to a JSON object, just a key-value pair. Every document has a   unique id, similar to primary keys in sql, that are created by MongoDB itself.
